qas.question: What place could officials not contact?
How many pandas live at the Reserve?
How many British visitors to the Reserve left unharmed?
How many pandas escaped the reserve?
How many security guards died at the reserve?
What famous panda was killed under the rubble?

context: Initially, officials were unable to contact <a0_0>the <a4_0>Wolong National Nature Reserve<a4_0/><a0_0/>, home to <a1_0>around <a3_0>2<a3_0/>80<a1_0/> giant pandas. However, the Foreign Ministry later said that a group of <a2_0>31<a2_0/> British tourists visiting the Wolong Panda Reserve in the quake-hit area returned safe and uninjured to Chengdu. Nonetheless, the well-being of an even greater number of pandas in the neighbouring panda reserves remained unknown. Five security guards at the reserve were killed by the earthquake. <a5_0>Six<a5_0/> pandas escaped after their enclosures were damaged. By May 20, two pandas at the reserve were found to be injured, while the search continued for another two adult pandas that went missing after the quake. By May 28, 2008, one panda was still missing. The missing panda was later found dead under the rubble of an enclosure. Nine-year-old <a7_0>Mao Mao<a7_0/>, a mother of <a6_0>five<a6_0/> at the breeding center, was discovered on Monday, her body crushed by a wall in her enclosure. Panda keepers and other workers placed her remains in a small wooden crate and buried her outside the breeding centre.
